curam.util.type

Class Blob

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.type.Blob
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Blob
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Blob represents a chunk of binary data. Blobs are fundamentally immutable, which means that their values can be shared safely among multiple referents. There is one caveat. In order to minimize copying of large blocks of data, it is possible to construct a Blob with a byte array ( Constructor) which becomes the Blob's internal storage. It is up to the developer to ensure that a reference to the byte array is not used to modify the contents of the Blob after it has been constructed.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • kEmptyBlob

        public static final Blob kEmptyBlob
        Convenience variable holding empty Blob values which can be shared between referents.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Blob

        public Blob()
        Blob constructor. The Blob is initialized to be empty.

      • Blob

        public Blob(byte[] byteArray)
        Constructs a Blob from the byte array input. The Blob is initialized to refer to the input byteArray argument. This constructor can be used to minimize copying overhead when constructing a Blob, but beware that subsequent modifications will affect the Blob contents.
        Parameters:
        byteArray - The input byte array.

      • Blob

        public Blob(byte[] byteArray,
            int position,
            int length)
        Constructs a Blob from a portion of the byte array input using the starting position and required length. The blob is initialized to contain a copy of the specified portion of input argument byteArray.
        Parameters:
        byteArray - The Input byte array.
        position - Starting position from which to start copying.
        length - Number of bytes to copy.

    • Method Detail

      • concatenate

        public Blob concatenate(byte[] byteArray)
        Constructs a Blob by appending the byte array to the contents of this Blob.
        Parameters:
        byteArray - The Input byte array.
        Returns:
        The newly created Blob.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object rightHandSide)
        Compare this Blob to another object.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        rightHandSide - Blob to compare to.
        Returns:
        true if the specified object is an instance of Blob, and contains the same bytes as this.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
             throws UnimplementedException
        Obtain a hash code for this type. This operation is not supported as this type should not be hashed.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        undefined, this method will always throw an exception.
        Throws:
        UnimplementedException - This operation is not supported.

      • copyBytes

        public byte[] copyBytes()
        Obtain a copy of the contents of the Blob.
        Returns:
        byte array of the Blob's contents. If the Blob is empty a byte array of length zero is returned.

      • length

        public int length()
        Obtain the current length of the Blob.
        Returns:
        byte array of the Blob's contents. An empty Blob has a length of zero.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a English language text version of a portion of the Blob. This routine is for "cosmetic" display purposes, not for conversion.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string including the length of the Blob, and a hexadecimal representation of up to 16 bytes of the Blob's value. The entire Blob is not returned for efficiency reasons.
